Predicate-remains_related_to.label: remains related to
Predicate-remains_related_to.description: The predicate 'remains related to' indicates a connection between two entities where one entity (the subject) continues to have an association or link with another entity (the object). This relationship suggests that the subject has been, is currently, and/or will continue to be connected to the object in some way.

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates a relationship where the subject is an integral component or constituent part of the object. It suggests that the subject has a significant connection to, and is closely tied with, the object.

Predicate-and.label: and
Predicate-and.description: The predicate 'and' connects the subject to the object by indicating a conjunction or combination of two entities. It suggests that the subject and object share common characteristics, properties, or functions.

Predicate-implementation_of.label: implementation of
Predicate-implementation_of.description: The predicate 'implementation of' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g. ELF) represents an entity that embodies or carries out the object (e.g. module implementation), which describes the manner or process by which the subject operates, functions, or is structured.

Predicate-is_related_to.label: is related to
Predicate-is_related_to.description: The predicate 'is related to' indicates a connection or association between two entities (subject and object), suggesting that they share some common characteristic, function, purpose, or context. This relationship can be based on various aspects such as functionality, design, usage, or conceptual similarity.

Predicate-compile_with.label: compile with
Predicate-compile_with.description: The predicate 'compile with' indicates a relationship where the subject (a compiler or compilation process) incorporates specific settings, parameters, or configurations into its operation. The object represents these settings, which are used to customize or modify the behavior of the compiling process.

Predicate-reference.label: reference
Predicate-reference.description: The predicate 'reference' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) serves as a point of origin or starting point for another entity (the object). In this context, it suggests that the compiled kernel is derived from or based on the kernel git repository [30].

Predicate-cross-compiles.label: cross-compiles
Predicate-cross-compiles.description: The predicate 'cross-compiles' indicates that a subject (typically an executable or compiler) generates code for another platform or architecture, which is represented by the object. In other words, it describes the process of translating source code from one programming environment to another, allowing programs written in one language or on one machine to run on another.

Predicate-compile.label: compile
Predicate-compile.description: To compile means to transform or process information into a specific form or structure, often resulting in a tangible product. In this sense, the predicate 'compile' connects the subject (the entity performing the action) with the object (the thing being transformed), indicating that the subject is actively involved in shaping or creating the object through some kind of processing or conversion.

Predicate-cross-compile.label: cross-compile
Predicate-cross-compile.description: To convert and compile code written for one platform or programming language into a form that can be executed on another platform or language.

Predicate-were_able_to_achieve_a_bootabl.label: were able to achieve a bootable
Predicate-were_able_to_achieve_a_bootabl.description: Indicates that an entity (subject) successfully accomplished or reached a state where it can function as intended with the object being the specific outcome or result. The predicate highlights the achievement of a milestone, implying effort and potential challenges overcome to reach this point.

Predicate-will_be_used_as.label: will be used as
Predicate-will_be_used_as.description: The predicate 'will be used as' indicates a relationship where the subject (a thing or concept) serves a specific purpose or function for another entity, represented by the object. This connection implies that the subject will fulfill its intended role or serve as something else.

Predicate-recreates.label: recreates
Predicate-recreates.description: Recreates refers to the process of creating or generating something anew, often based on a previous version or template. This predicate indicates that the subject has created an object from scratch or reworked it into its current form.

Predicate-builds.label: builds
Predicate-builds.description: The predicate 'builds' indicates a process of creation or construction that results in the production of something new. It implies a transformation from an initial state to a more complex or organized form, often involving planning, design, and execution.

Predicate-comprises.label: comprises
Predicate-comprises.description: The predicate 'comprises' indicates that the subject (a collection or entity) contains or consists of one or more objects. It implies a whole-part relationship, where the subject encompasses and includes all or part of the object(s).

Predicate-add.label: add
Predicate-add.description: The predicate 'add' indicates a process of combining or incorporating elements to form a new whole. It suggests an action that increases the quantity, scope, or complexity of something by bringing together distinct parts.

Predicate-shows.label: shows
Predicate-shows.description: Indicates a visual representation or demonstration of something by the subject, typically highlighting its characteristics, features, or properties.

Predicate-has_been_compared_to.label: has been compared to
Predicate-has_been_compared_to.description: The predicate 'has been compared to' indicates a relationship where the subject (in this case RISC-V) shares similarities or characteristics with something else (the object, architectures), suggesting that it has been likened or equated to those other entities.

Predicate-have_started.label: have started
Predicate-have_started.description: The predicate 'have started' indicates that the subject has initiated or begun an activity, process, or endeavor described by the object. It implies a point of commencement or inception, marking the beginning of something new.

Predicate-become_members_of.label: become members of
Predicate-become_members_of.description: To indicate a change in status or affiliation from non-members to members, typically involving formal registration, acceptance of rules and regulations, or commitment to shared goals. The predicate 'become members of' connects the subject (an entity) with an organization or group that has established membership criteria.

Predicate-gain_momentum_with.label: gain momentum with
Predicate-gain_momentum_with.description: To gain momentum with a particular entity or concept means to acquire increasing support, attention, and relevance for that entity or concept. This predicate indicates a process of building energy, enthusiasm, and interest around something, often resulting in its growing influence, popularity, or impact.

Predicate-performed_on.label: performed on
Predicate-performed_on.description: The predicate 'performed on' indicates a relationship where an action or process was carried out with respect to something. It suggests that the subject performed some activity, task, or operation directly upon or in relation to the object.

Predicate-will_be_applied_on.label: will be applied on
Predicate-will_be_applied_on.description: Indicates that a specific process or methodology (subject) will be utilized to operate upon or manipulate something else (object), typically with the intention of achieving a particular outcome, result, or effect.

Predicate-will_give_more_accurate_result.label: will give more accurate results using
Predicate-will_give_more_accurate_result.description: This predicate indicates that a specific method or approach (subject) produces more precise outcomes when utilizing a particular tool, technology, or resource (object). The connection between subject and object suggests that the chosen methodology benefits from using the specified means to achieve greater accuracy.

Predicate-will_have_a_better_understandi.label: will have a better understanding of
Predicate-will_have_a_better_understandi.description: This predicate indicates a future state where the subject has acquired or developed a deeper comprehension or insight about the object. It implies a process of learning, investigation, or exploration that will lead to an enhanced understanding.

Predicate-will_offer_more.label: will offer more
Predicate-will_offer_more.description: The predicate 'will offer more' indicates a future action of providing additional or enhanced features, services, or resources to the object. The subject is expected to take an active role in making these offerings available, potentially improving or expanding its capabilities related to the object.

Predicate-porting_will_be_further_explor.label: porting will be further explored for
Predicate-porting_will_be_further_explor.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (e.g., an architecture or technology) has challenges or complexities related to its porting process that will be investigated further. The object represents the specific aspect of the porting process being explored, such as difficulties at a particular level (e.g., kernel).

Predicate-will_be_performed_on.label: will be performed on
Predicate-will_be_performed_on.description: This predicate indicates a relationship of execution or application context between two entities. It specifies that an action (the subject) will take place within a particular environment, framework, or medium (the object), which provides the conditions for its performance.

Predicate-implementations_of.label: implementations of
Predicate-implementations_of.description: The predicate 'implementations of' indicates a relationship between a concept or technology (the subject) and its specific instantiations, versions, or variations that adhere to certain principles, standards, or philosophies (the object).

Predicate-can_be_modified_by.label: can be modified by
Predicate-can_be_modified_by.description: The predicate 'can be modified by' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject has its properties or characteristics altered or changed through some means specified by the object. The object represents an entity, process, or mechanism that enables modification of the subject's attributes.

Predicate-bring_about.label: bring about
Predicate-bring_about.description: To cause or result in something happening or existing. The predicate 'bring about' indicates that the subject has an instrumental role in creating or inducing a specific state, situation, or outcome.

Predicate-responding_to.label: responding to
Predicate-responding_to.description: The predicate 'responding to' indicates that the subject (an entity or organization) takes action or provides a reaction in response to something specified by the object. This can imply a sense of engagement, consideration, or reaction to an idea, proposal, request, or other stimulus.

Predicate-seems_to_be_the_best_candidate.label: seems to be the best candidate for
Predicate-seems_to_be_the_best_candidate.description: Indicates that the subject has a high likelihood of fulfilling or meeting the requirements specified by the object. The predicate suggests that the subject possesses qualities or characteristics that make it well-suited for the task, role, or purpose described in the object.

Predicate-designed.label: designed
Predicate-designed.description: The predicate 'designed' indicates that someone or something intentionally created a plan, blueprint, or specification to achieve a specific goal or outcome. It implies a deliberate and intentional process of planning, conceptualizing, or engineering, which results in the creation of an object, system, or concept.

Predicate-is_designed_by.label: is designed by
Predicate-is_designed_by.description: The predicate 'is designed by' indicates a relationship between an entity (the subject) and its creator or originator. It suggests that the subject has been intentionally created, developed, or conceived by the object, which is often an individual, organization, or group responsible for bringing the subject into existence.

Predicate-is_an_open-source_instruction_.label: is an open-source instruction set architecture developed as an alternative to
Predicate-is_an_open-source_instruction_.description: This predicate describes a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) is an open-source Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) that has been developed as an alternative to another ISA or architecture. The object represents the original or existing ISA that this new ISA aims to replace, modify, or improve upon.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship of dependence or reliance between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject utilizes, employs, or exploits the object to achieve its purpose, function, or operation.

Predicate-form_the_basis.label: form the basis
Predicate-form_the_basis.description: To 'form the basis' of a predicate means to establish or serve as the fundamental foundation, starting point, or underlying principle for something. It implies that the subject provides the essential groundwork, framework, or structure upon which the object is built, developed, or understood.

Predicate-design_and_manufacture.label: design and manufacture
Predicate-design_and_manufacture.description: To create or bring into existence a product, system, or concept by planning its features, structure, and functionality (design), followed by the process of producing it according to those plans (manufacture).

Predicate-is_connected_through.label: is connected through
Predicate-is_connected_through.description: The predicate 'is connected through' indicates a relationship of logical or conceptual connection between two entities. It suggests that there exists an underlying structure, principle, or mechanism that links the subject and object together, often implying a sense of unity, coherence, or correspondence.

Predicate-exemplify.label: exemplify
Predicate-exemplify.description: To exemplify means to serve as a representative or typical instance of something else. It indicates that the subject has characteristics, features, or properties similar to those found in the object, often used for comparison, illustration, or explanation purposes.

Predicate-is_an_adaptation.label: is an adaptation
Predicate-is_an_adaptation.description: The predicate 'is an adaptation' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (subject) has been modified or transformed to fit another entity (object), often with the goal of achieving compatibility, efficiency, or improved performance. In this context, the subject is the adapted thing itself, and the object represents the original concept, standard, or architecture that it was adapted from.

Predicate-is_designed_for.label: is designed for
Predicate-is_designed_for.description: The predicate 'is designed for' indicates a purpose or intended use relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject (in this case, an architecture) has been created with a specific goal in mind to fulfill the needs of the object (the instruction set). This connection implies a functional or operational link between the two entities.

Predicate-is_designed_as.label: is designed as
Predicate-is_designed_as.description: The predicate 'is designed as' indicates a conceptual or abstract relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has been intentionally created, structured, or organized to conform to the characteristics or principles described by the object. In other words, it implies that the subject's design or architecture is modeled after or inspired by the object.

Predicate-is_the_subject_of.label: is the subject of
Predicate-is_the_subject_of.description: The predicate 'is the subject of' indicates a relationship where the subject refers to or represents the topic being studied or described in the object. The object typically denotes an investigation, research study, or analysis that focuses on the subject.

Predicate-is_designed_to_be.label: is designed to be
Predicate-is_designed_to_be.description: The predicate 'is designed to be' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject has been intentionally created or intended to fulfill a specific purpose or function, as described by the object. In general, this predicate suggests that the subject is meant to embody or conform to certain characteristics, properties, or standards specified in the object.

Predicate-designed_specifically.label: designed specifically
Predicate-designed_specifically.description: The predicate 'designed specifically' indicates that a subject has been intentionally created or engineered to fulfill a specific purpose or requirement, as defined by its object. It implies a deliberate and intentional design process aimed at achieving a particular goal or characteristic.

Predicate-is_an_alternative_to.label: is an alternative to
Predicate-is_an_alternative_to.description: The predicate 'is an alternative to' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) offers a substitute or replacement option compared to another entity (the object). This connection highlights that the subject and object are competing solutions, with the subject being presented as a viable choice instead of the original.

Predicate-designed_specifically_for.label: designed specifically for
Predicate-designed_specifically_for.description: The predicate 'designed specifically for' indicates a purposeful creation or adaptation of something (the subject) to fulfill a particular requirement, function, or need defined by its intended use case (the object).

Predicate-is_an_alternative.label: is an alternative
Predicate-is_an_alternative.description: The predicate 'is an alternative' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (subject) offers a different or substitute option for another entity (object). It suggests that the subject is not the primary choice, but rather a viable alternative to consider.

Predicate-designs.label: designs
Predicate-designs.description: To design means to create or develop a plan, concept, or blueprint for something. The subject of this predicate has taken an active role in shaping and structuring the object, which can be a product, system, process, or idea. This connection implies that the subject is responsible for bringing their creative vision into being.

Predicate-is_designed_by_(1).label: is designed by
Predicate-is_designed_by_(1).description: The predicate 'is designed by' indicates a relationship between an entity (subject) and its creator or originator. It suggests that the subject has been intentionally created, developed, or conceived by the object, which is often an individual, organization, or group with expertise in designing or creating entities of similar type.

Predicate-paves_the_way.label: paves the way
Predicate-paves_the_way.description: Indicates that the subject has created a path or opportunity for the object to follow, often implying a sense of innovation, progress, or breakthrough. The predicate suggests that the subject's actions have cleared a way forward, making it possible for the object to emerge, develop, or succeed.

Predicate-paves_the_way_for.label: paves the way for
Predicate-paves_the_way_for.description: Indicates that the subject has created a path or opportunity for something (represented by the object) to happen, develop, or be achieved. This predicate suggests a causal relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the subject's actions have facilitated or enabled the emergence of the object.

Predicate-compared.label: compared
Predicate-compared.description: The predicate 'compared' indicates a relationship of similarity or contrast between two entities. It suggests that the subject and object are being evaluated in relation to each other, often with the intention of highlighting their differences or similarities.

Predicate-design_and_manufacture_based_o.label: design and manufacture based on
Predicate-design_and_manufacture_based_o.description: This predicate indicates a relationship where the subject (primary architectures) has its specifications or characteristics defined by the object (RISC-V processor manufacturers), which serves as the foundation for designing and manufacturing. In general, this predicate suggests that the design and manufacture of something are influenced by or conform to the principles, standards, or guidelines provided by the object.

Predicate-designs_and_manufactures_proce.label: designs and manufactures processors based on
Predicate-designs_and_manufactures_proce.description: This predicate describes a relationship where the subject entity creates or produces processing units that rely on or utilize the object concept. The connection between the subject and object indicates that the processor's functionality, architecture, or operation is grounded in the instruction set specified by the object.

Predicate-is_compared_with.label: is compared with
Predicate-is_compared_with.description: The predicate 'is compared with' indicates a relationship of similarity or equivalence between two entities. It suggests that the subject and object share common characteristics, features, or properties, allowing for a comparison to be made.

Predicate-uses_the_same_RISC-architectur.label: uses the same RISC-architecture
Predicate-uses_the_same_RISC-architectur.description: This predicate indicates that two entities share a common architectural design or structure in terms of Reduced Instruction Set Computing (RISC). It implies an equivalence or similarity between the subject's and object's RISC-architecture, suggesting they have similar computational properties or capabilities.

Predicate-is_designed_as_an_alternative.label: is designed as an alternative
Predicate-is_designed_as_an_alternative.description: The predicate 'is designed as an alternative' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) has been intentionally created or intended to serve as a substitute, replacement, or equivalent for another entity (the object).

Predicate-forms_the_basis.label: forms the basis
Predicate-forms_the_basis.description: The predicate 'forms the basis' indicates that the subject provides a fundamental foundation or starting point for the object. It suggests that the subject serves as an underlying structure, principle, or framework upon which the object is built, developed, or understood.

Predicate-is_designed_to_be_used_with.label: is designed to be used with
Predicate-is_designed_to_be_used_with.description: This predicate indicates a relationship between two entities where one (the subject) has been intentionally created or intended for use in conjunction with another (the object). The connection is not necessarily physical, but rather conceptual or functional. In general, the subject and object are designed to work together seamlessly, often sharing characteristics, properties, or purposes.

Predicate-exemplifies.label: exemplifies
Predicate-exemplifies.description: The predicate 'exemplifies' connects a subject to an object by indicating that the subject serves as a representative or model for the object. It suggests that the subject possesses characteristics, features, or qualities that are typical of or characteristic of the object.

Predicate-The_ARM_processor_exemplifies_.label: The ARM processor exemplifies the Reduced Instruction Set Computer (RISC) architecture, which simplifies command sets and improves processing speed.
Predicate-The_ARM_processor_exemplifies_.description: This predicate connects a subject (e.g. an entity or concept) to the Reduced Instruction Set Computer (RISC) architecture by indicating that it embodies, represents, or exemplifies the characteristics and principles of RISC design. The predicate also highlights the benefits of this embodiment, such as simplified command sets and improved processing speed.

Predicate-is_exemplified_by.label: is exemplified by
Predicate-is_exemplified_by.description: This predicate indicates that the subject represents or embodies the characteristics, features, or properties described in the object. The connection between the subject and object is one of exemplification, where the subject serves as a concrete instance or illustration of the abstract concept or idea represented by the object.

Predicate-was_developed_as_an_open-sourc.label: was developed as an open-source
Predicate-was_developed_as_an_open-sourc.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (typically a software or technology project) has been created and made available under an open-source license, allowing others to access, modify, and distribute the source code. The object typically refers to the specific entity being developed as open-source, such as a processor instruction set.

Predicate-follows.label: follows
Predicate-follows.description: The predicate 'follows' indicates a relationship of derivation or adherence between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject is based on, conforms to, or is an extension of the object, implying a logical connection or dependency.

Predicate-follow.label: follow
Predicate-follow.description: The predicate 'follow' indicates a relationship where the subject adheres to or conforms with the object's principles, guidelines, standards, or specifications. This connection implies that the subject adopts and maintains consistency with the object's characteristics, rules, or norms.

Predicate-provide.label: provide
Predicate-provide.description: The predicate 'provide' indicates a relationship where the subject offers or makes available something (the object), often implying a sense of fulfillment or satisfaction. In this context, it suggests that the open-source RISC-V implementations are responsible for offering or providing the adaptation to the RISC architecture.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of the object concept. It represents an is-a relationship, where the subject is a more detailed or specialized version of the object.
